headline: ACCEL CORP. SEMI-AUTOMATIC CENTRIFUGAL CLEANING SYSTEM
description:
Semi-Automatic Centrifugal Cleaning System    Used for cleaning  electronic  assemblies 
Three step process.: Washing, rinsing, drying 
 Circuit assemblies 
 Precision parts 
 Medical devices 
 Bumper wafers 
 Flip chips , MCMs, BGAs,  and hybrid circuits 
No drain or waste water treatment required 
Automatic recovery of solvents from waste water 
Four stage water purification process
specstable:
Manufacturer Accel
Model MICROCEL II
Description Semi-Automatic Centrifugal Cleaning System
Other Information Cleaning: 0.0 - 2.0 gr NaCl/in2, resistivity of Solvent extract testing per DOD-STD-2000-1
Drying: 100%, no moisture remaining on product
Throughput: up to 200 ft2/hour, depending on product
Speed range 0 to 1000 RPM
Process time:
  • Wash--0.5 to 2.0 minutes, typical
  • Rinse–1.0 to 2.0 minutes, typical
  • Dry–2.0 to 3.0 minutes, typical
    Chemistries:
  • Aqueous, Bio T200A
  • Axarel, Ionox HC
  • Armakleen, Ionox FCR
  • Bioact, EC-7R IPA
  • Bioact EC-15, Zestron
    Microcel II same machine, chamber has 16" Dia. will handle a 13" board
    More information available
    • Power Requirements 220 V 70.0 A 60 Hz 1 Phase
    Year of Manufacture 1995
    Exterior Dimensions
    Width 75.000 in (190.5 cm)
    Depth 38.000 in (96.5 cm)
    Height 41.000 in (104.1 cm)
    Weight 1,250 lb (567 kg)
